Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2007 01:03PM - edited Nov 9, 2007 01:04PM by php01 I am on navalbene right now for mets--and my doc says I haven't been on it (5 bouts) long enough to know if it is stopping the activity--or slowing the lesions--but when I take my next tumor marker 27/29 test the end of this month (nov) I will let you know if it is working. when my doctor first said navalbene as a possible chemo drug for me, one of 3 he was suggesting--I was just going to Mayo clinic for a second opinion---and my Mayo doctor told me that navalbene was an EXCELLENT drug of choice for mets, and he said to go home and let my onc start it. So i did.
Posts.Title: Ughhhhhh,A Bad Day...... zarowny9 celia088

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2007 07:45AM php01 wrote: I had bc spread to the lymph nodes in my neck, my lungs and my clavicle and a rib bone--after last pet scan I have affected nodes clear to my diaphram and more activity in lungs I am now on Navalbene and hoping that this will stop the activity and put the lesions into recession.  This is my 3rd round of chemo, my second was gemzar and taxophere, but during my 4th bout of that we found the new activity so we just quit it. Then I went to Mayo and got a second opinion, and they sent me back to my oncologist saying he is on the right track and we should start again--so we did.  I take the Navalbene every week, and am getting some side effects, but am getting through it.    Get the biopsy and a scan and find out where you are.
Posts.Title: Breast cancer spread to lymph node in neck sockmonkey yangtan
